label: amiodarone is predicted to reduce the clearance of simvastatin by inhibition of CYP3A4

ddiPkMechanism: Inhibition of metabolism of simvastatin/ lovastatin by CYP3A4
effectConcept: Increased simvastatin/ lovastatin concentrations and risk of myopathy/ rhabdomyolysis
label: None
managementOptions: Usually Avoid ·Consider Alternatives: Preferable statin alternatives include fluvastatin, rosuvastatin, or pravastatin. Predisposing risk factors for rhabdomyolysis include advanced age (>65 years), uncontrolled hypothyroidism, and renal impairment. ·Monitor: If alternative statins are not appropriate, monitor the patient for evidence of myopathy (muscle pain or weakness) and myoglobinuria (dark urine). The simvastatin dose should not exceed 20 mg/day in combination with amiodarone.
